Dave Skinner wrote:

> I'm wondering if a way to get the disktest  to fail would be to create a
> file, write one record in it, and close it.  (hopefully then the os would
> know that you are serious about wanting a file)  then try to create 
> another
> file assuming that the first file is a directory....   I *think* that is
> similar to what I had done with java 1.4 and it failed reliably.  but I
> lost what I had done when I update my local copy from head and 
> switched to
> java 1.5.  I created the disktest stuff in /tmp assuming it would be 
> OK to
> leave any left over wreckage from the test there.  I get nervous about
> creating crud in either /proc or /dev.
>
> hmmm.  just wondered if a way to get the failure would be to create a
> directory and then treat the directory as if it were a file to get the
> error....  I guess I should go look at the code.  but this is not the 
> most
> important bug on my list today.  Somehow I doubt that it is high on
> anyone's list.

Nice idea.  I added back the failed-creation test using your suggestion 
above.
Thanks.
St.Ack

>
> I'd be happy to try anything on fedora that needs to be tried, but I hate
> to waste time on it if anyone else is  chasing it.  If I were to 
> update the
> java engine on them, I could test a number of different linux 
> environments.
>
> At 06:17 PM 1/21/2005, you wrote:
>
> >Dave Skinner wrote:
> >
> > >
> > > >
> > > >I am runnning with Sun's JRE build 1.4.1_02-b06, but I doubt that
> > > >matters.
> > >
> > > I could not  make heritrix with 1.4.1_02b06 work under fedora 
> core3.  I
> > > upgraded to (sun) jdk1.5.0_01 and it works
> > >
> > > I also had the disk test fail and made a bug report about it.  the
> > > test is
> > > creating a file in /dev while making an assumption that it wont be
> > > able to
> > > create it.  I patched it while using 1.4 but when I upgraded to 1.5 it
> > > failed (to fail) again in a slightly different way.  someone is 
> going to
> > > have to figure out a way that it consistently fails in different
> > > environments.
> >
> >Dave:
> >
> >First, thanks for the bug reports related to filters.
> >
> >I've commented out the test till we figure a universally uncreateable
> >file name (I thought we could change the directory for the uncreateable
> >file from '/dev' to '/proc' which'd work for linux but not necessarily
> >on other OSs).
> >
> >St.Ack
> >
> >
> >
